product_name: Hot ToolsPro Artist 24K Gold Collection Extended Barrel Curling Iron
summary: SummaryFrom an extended barrel, and fast heat-up to more precise heat temperatures, Hot Tool's award-winning Pro Artist 24K Gold Curling Iron Collection has been updated to help you create all the long-lasting curls and waves you can imagine.
details: DetailsBenefitsEasier, faster styling thanks to the extended barrelFan-Favorite 24K Gold Technology for fast heat-up, consistent heat, and long-lasting stylesGreat for styling longer lengths and hard-to-reach sectionsLess time & damage with more room to wrap sections evenly, helping every strand to be heated on the first passMore Precision and Control with a temperature control buttonMultiple digital heat settings reaching 450ÀöF that cover all hair types1 ¬º‚Äù Barrel Size for creating styles like soft natural, loose waves or curlsFeaturesExtended Barrel longer styling surface for faster + easier stylingTemperature Control Button for more precision + controlMultiple Digital Heat Settings (from 280ÀöF to 450ÀöF) for all hair typesTemperature Memory RecallExtra-Long Cool Tip2-Hr. Auto Shut-OffAutomatic Dual VoltageTangle-Free Swivel CordItem 2615725How To UseStart with dry hair and section into manageable areas to work withSet iron to the desired temperature for your hair typeStarting with a single section (about 1"), take iron and open the clamp. Starting at the top (use caution near the scalp), place the section between the barrel & clamp, then closeWith the clamp still closed, twist the iron in an outward direction (away from the face) and continue twisting as you move down the section until it's fully wrapped around the barrelPRO TIP: Stop wrapping when you reach the section's last ¬º - ¬Ω" so that some ends stay uncurled. This gives you a beachy feelHold the section for 4-8 seconds (depending on hair type) then open the clamp and releasePRO TIP: Once the section is released from iron, grab section from the bottom with your hand and reform the curl. Either hold it or pin it until it's cool. This helps styles last even longerRepeat with remaining sectionsCaution: For External Use Only
how_to_use: Start with dry hair and section into manageable areas to work withSet iron to the desired temperature for your hair typeStarting with a single section (about 1"), take iron and open the clamp. Starting at the top (use caution near the scalp), place the section between the barrel & clamp, then closeWith the clamp still closed, twist the iron in an outward direction (away from the face) and continue twisting as you move down the section until it's fully wrapped around the barrelPRO TIP: Stop wrapping when you reach the section's last ¬º - ¬Ω" so that some ends stay uncurled. This gives you a beachy feelHold the section for 4-8 seconds (depending on hair type) then open the clamp and releasePRO TIP: Once the section is released from iron, grab section from the bottom with your hand and reform the curl. Either hold it or pin it until it's cool. This helps styles last even longerRepeat with remaining sectionsCaution: For External Use Only

reviews.headline: Great curling iron!
reviews.comments: Heats up fast and quickly delivers great curls!  My second one to replace one I had used for years.

reviews.headline: Not the same quality
reviews.comments: I have only used Hot Tools curling irons for over 20 years.  However they have changed the design and I have not been able to secure the hair around the barrel as the clamp often sticks or does not create a firm grasp.  Returned one and 2nd one is doing the same.

reviews.headline: HATE THE NEW CHANGES!!!
reviews.comments: I've lost count at how many of these extended barrel curling irons I have purchased & would die if I added up how mhch money has been spent on Hot Tools. However I am incredibly disappointed at the changes they have made to this specific model. I do love the new temp button instead of the dial, genius! However the extended barrel of the one I bought today is a whole inch shorter than the one I bought in May 2025. The tip of the curling iron is no longer one that rotates as you twist it either. Not to mention, its $10 more & less "product". I will be returning the new one & will be going with a new brand moving forward. This is a perfect example of‚Ä¶if it aint broke dont fix it!!!

reviews.headline: Spring broke
reviews.comments: I have always loved this brand of curling irons because they usually last for years. I bought this one in November, and suddenly the spring broke so it's no longer usable. So disappointing. Trying to decide if I should purchase another one or go with a cheaper one if I'm going to have to replace it after six or seven months anyway.

reviews.headline: Lasted me 15 years!!!
reviews.comments: This curling iron has lasted me 15 years! This is a must buy.

reviews.headline: My favorite curling iron!
reviews.comments: I have tried many other curling irons and this one exceeds them all. To the length of the iron, to the larger tip that prevents burns, to the auto shut-off‚Ä¶.there is nothing I would change.

reviews.headline: Works great but broke fast
reviews.comments: I bought this curling iron in the fall and used it 2-3x a week since- suddenly stopped working in June in the middle of doing my hair, and I can't find any reason why! Bummer but will not be repurchasing- can't have half curled hair again! LOL

reviews.headline: Great curling iron
reviews.comments: This iron is good quality. I bought one that was cheaper at another store and had to return it because it was a cheaper quality even tho it was the same brand.

reviews.headline: I would definitely buy again
reviews.comments: Perfect for giving your hair body and movement.

reviews.headline: amazing
reviews.comments: omg I love this curling iron smmm! it gives my hair an amazing look, use this almost everyday it's that good!! get so many compliments.. def would recomend!!

reviews.headline: Should've listened to reviewers
reviews.comments: Ugh, the spring and clamp get stuck like other reviewers mentioned. Hot tools does have a warranty but not sure if it'll be covered. Highly recommend getting a different brand.

reviews.headline: this is not an extended barrel.
reviews.comments: it works, but it's not an extended barrel at all.    i have the 1 inch extended and that actually is an extended barrel.    it'll do for now.

reviews.headline: Waste of money
reviews.comments: Does not curl hair at all. Tried to give it multiple chances before i had to return.

reviews.headline: Love this.
reviews.comments: I've used Hot Tools for years and they work great for my hair. I have fine hair and I usually use two at one time in two different sizes. They last a long time as well.

reviews.headline: 2" iron gives perfect loose waves
reviews.comments:
The first curling iron with a clamp I've ever used and the 2" curling iron was easy to learn how to use even at 30 years old to get the perfect loose waves. Love it! Great purchase.

My only con is that it is easy to accidentally hit the temperature setting button while curling (others mentioned this). But I just hit it again a few times to get it back where I want it. It's not a dealbreaker.

reviews.headline: ABSOLUTELY love this curling iron.
reviews.comments: My hair is medium to long length and doesn't normally hold a curl. This curling iron holds it all day (even on wash day) and it does the big curls for volume! Highly recommend this tool!

reviews.headline: electrical issues
reviews.comments: had this curling iron for a little over a year and have been noticing some issues with the wiring, its now at the point where it will turn off even while plugged in and turned "on", making it basically unusable at this point. really frustrating, and unfortunately its past the warranty. pretty disappointing, always thought hot tools was one of the higher end brands for curling irons.

reviews.headline: Returned
reviews.comments: I purchased this one after my favorite Hot Tools curling iron decided it no longer wanted to turn on (had over 10 years). As others have stated, should have listened to the reviews. Hot Tools quality has gone down terribly! If I was able to get my hair to actually stay in the curling iron strands would then get stuck in the spring! Add on to that within an hour my hair was straight. I have wavy, confused, thick hair that can hold a curl with the right iron. This one is not that.

reviews.headline: Love it
reviews.comments: I love this curling iron. Great product for the price. Very reliable. This is my third curling iron from this maker. I would definitely buy another product from the speaker again.

reviews.headline: Waste of money
reviews.comments: I ordered this during cyber Monday so excited, I received it today & it is clearly a returned item. It was covered in finger prints & residue. I still gave it the benefit of the doubt when I should have taken it as used as a sign. Curls do not hold, when it does make a curl. I used small sections and it still only curled the ends of my hair. I'm returning and I'm disappointed.

media.headline: My favorite styling tool for curls
My favorite styling tool for curls

faceoff_positive.comments: I recieved Hot tools 1.5" Extended Barrel Curling Iron curtosy of Influenster in exchange for my honest opinion. Hot Tools curling Iron ofers a variety of features to create a flawless hairstyle. The Gold barrel acts as a thermal conducting until that evenly distributes heat all the way across its surface. Menaing no matter how you curl your hair, it will be evenly heated all the way across its surface area. It has a rotatable cord that makes it easy to turn the iron in your hands as it is being used, but it makes it slightly difficult to set the curler down without it tipping of its stand. I found the easiest way to remedy this is to have the cord hang off the edge of the counter, which brings back the curlers equilibrium. It creates the most beautiful full volume curls in a manner of seconds. The iron itself offers a range of temperatures from 280 degrees (F) to 480 degrees (F). I set it at 380 and it took all of 2 minutes to get hot-hot. It has an automatic 2 hour shut off, but it only took 30 minutes for me to style my medium-thick wavy hair.  (I did use in conjunction with Not Your Mother's Thermal Heat Spray to protect my hair.) Another feautre would be that there is a black plastic tip at the extended end, which is meant to help stabalize and roll the hair in the iron without getting too hot, but about 15 minutes in I noticed the  piece was almost equally as warm at the actual iron was. Just a warning to be careful and monitor your tool as you are using it. A heat glove would also help here. Its 2 volt compatible so it is great for travel and use with an adapter without shorting out the iron (110v Us, 220v rest of globe). Overall, special attention was put not only into the features this product has, but specifically how a person would use these features, and I really appreciate that Hot Tools took that extra step to consider the end-user. My curls were big and volumous, and stayed in its curl pattern until I brushed them out that evening (i also tested a wide tooth comb and did not affect the curl pattern excpet by making it slightly looser). It got hot very quickly, which saved me time in my morning routine, and my curls lasted all through my busy day.  This is a fantastic tool for busy women, moms on the run, and hairstylists trying to maximize their time. With a price tag of only $69.99 at Ulta, it is most certainly worth the money spent, and with that money spent, the time saved will pay its own self back. Its afforable, easipy used and easipy maintained. I am very pleased with this product, and Im excited to be adding it to my every day routine!
faceoff_positive.headline: Amazing Curler!

faceoff_negative.comments: Some things I love about the Hot Tools 1 ¬º extended barrel curling iron are: quick heat-up time, swivel cord, multiple heat settings, and it created a beautiful loose curl or beachy wave that lasted all day. My main con is that for being called an extended barrel, I did not find it to be much longer than some of my regular irons, which was a bit disappointing. For reference, I have long, fine, wavy hair and used the two lowest heat settings. I have tested styling with "dirty" hair and clean hair using this iron and I feel like both held well throughout the day. The only styling product I used before styling was a 3-in-1 protectant, detangler, smoothing spray. I would say this is a great hair tool and I would use it because it creates my favorite curl pattern and has some great functions, but if you are desiring or need an extended barrel, I would go with something else that has more length. Giving it 3 stars because I do not feel like the iron adequately reflects its name or I would have loved for the barrel to be longer. I received this product through the Stellar Product Testing Panel in exchange for my honest review.
faceoff_negative.headline: Great iron but questionable extended barrel
